intro: Morronea incumbens, commonly known as the white-flowered morronea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. Morronea incumbens is often found in swampy areas and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
